name: swe_ai_assistants_2024
context:
A psychometric survey evaluating software engineers' adoption of and sentiment toward AI coding tools.

Set in 2024, amidst the mainstream adoption of LLM-based tools like GitHub Copilot and ChatGPT, this instrument assesses how developers perceive these technologies impacting their profession. It explores whether engineers view AI as a productivity-enhancing partner or a threat to job security and code quality, while also measuring their practical willingness to integrate these tools into their daily workflows.

questions.preprompt: Considering {player_name}'s daily coding workflow, how much does {player_name} agree with the following:
questions.statement: Using AI coding assistants significantly increases the speed at which {player_name} completes routine programming tasks.

questions.preprompt: Reflecting on {player_name}'s experience with tools like Copilot or ChatGPT, evaluate the following statement:
questions.statement: AI tools distract {player_name} more than they help, often breaking their flow state.

questions.preprompt: Thinking about the utility of LLMs in software development, to what extent does {player_name} agree:
questions.statement: {player_name} believes that AI assistants allow them to focus on higher-level architecture rather than boilerplate code.

questions.preprompt: When {player_name} thinks about the future of the software engineering career path, how do they react to this statement:
questions.statement: {player_name} is worried that AI will make their specific engineering skillset obsolete within the next five years.

questions.preprompt: Assessing {player_name}'s job security in the age of AI, evaluate the following:
questions.statement: {player_name} feels confident that human creativity and problem-solving will always be irreplaceable in software engineering.

questions.preprompt: Considering the impact of automation on the tech industry, to what extent does {player_name} agree:
questions.statement: The rise of AI coding tools makes {player_name} fearful about the availability of junior developer roles in the future.

questions.preprompt: Regarding the reliability of AI-generated syntax and logic, how does {player_name} feel about this statement:
questions.statement: {player_name} trusts code snippets generated by AI to be secure and bug-free without extensive review.

questions.preprompt: When reviewing code produced by LLMs, to what extent does {player_name} agree with the following:
questions.statement: {player_name} believes that relying on AI tools leads to a degradation in the overall maintainability of the codebase.

questions.preprompt: Evaluating the technical accuracy of current AI models, how does {player_name} respond to this:
questions.statement: {player_name} finds that AI-suggested solutions for complex bugs are usually accurate and effective.

questions.preprompt: Thinking about best practices in software development, evaluate the following statement:
questions.statement: {player_name} suspects that AI tools frequently hallucinate non-existent libraries or deprecated syntax.
